answers.answer: You need to have your parents call an opthalmologist and make an emergency appointment for tomorrow morning.
Leave your contacts out. Tell your parents. See an ophthalmologist or your contact lens fitter tomorrow.JCH III MD
Ask for a thyroid blood test--hormones can cause blurriness.  Also, are you at risk for diabetes?  Have that checked as well.Hope you feel better soon.
Thanks, and yes, I did tell my parents. My dad has diabetes, but I don't think I'd be at risk, I'm extremely active.
I hink it depends on what kind of diabetes he has. See your MD and talk to him.Have you seen an eye md or your lems fitter since you wrote us on January2?

question: I am only 13 years old, I wear contacts, and today at about noon, I started getting blurry vison, and I tried everything; Contact Solution, Eyedrops, taking my contacts out and putting on glasses, nothing worked. It is now 6:55pm, and I'm still having this problem.Can anyone help me?
title: I'm only 13 & my eyes are blurring! HELP!
